greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Minimal number of smaller integer-sided squares that tile an n X n square.
comment: _Sascha Kurz_ has found a(n) for n <= 104, and up to this point he observes that a(n) is given by a(n) = min{ a(p) | p prime, p divides n } (cf. A211302). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 07 2012
link: Ed Wynn, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..126
Sascha Kurz, Squaring the square with integer linear programming, Journal of Information Processing, Vol. 20, Nr. 3 (2012), Pages 680-685; arXiv:1401.6387 [math.OC], 2014.
Ed Wynn, Exhaustive generation of Mrs Perkins's quilt square dissections for low orders, arXiv:1308.5420 [math.CO], 2013.
results.author: _David W. Wilson_
ext: Extended by _David W. Wilson_, using values from A211302
b-file from Wynn, 2013, added by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 29 2013
